turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Capitals–Penguins rivalry.
turn.1: Who were the teams the Capitals and Penguins played against in the first round?
turn.2: In the playoffs, the Capitals defeated the New York Rangers 4–3 in the conference quarterfinals, while the Penguins defeated their Pennsylvania rivals, the Flyers, in six games.
turn.3: Did they face each other in the finals?
turn.4: With the first (Boston Bruins), second (Washington Capitals), fourth (Pittsburgh Penguins), and sixth (Carolina Hurricanes) seeds remaining in the East, this set up the eighth playoff meeting between the Caps and the Pens.
turn.5: What city did the Caps-Pens play in first?
turn.6: The Caps– Pens 2009 series began in Washington.
turn.8: Sidney Crosby opened the scoring on a wrist shot in the first period, only to have Capitals centre David Steckel tie the game later on.
turn.10: Pittsburgh later found themselves trying to kill a 5-on-3 penalty, and Washington capitalized on it on a goal by Alexander Ovechkin assisted by Alex Semin to take a 2–1 lead.
turn.12: Mark Eaton tied the score at two a little over halfway into the game, but it was Tomas Fleischmann who scored the only goal of the third period to give Washington a 3–2 win and a 1–0 series lead.
